page.title: 15FARMING IN ST VEEP
page.content: Most farmers keep{cattle}to be fattened and killed for{beef,}and some also keep{sheep}for{wool}and{meat. A lot of time is taken in fattening up cattle. They have to be bought from the{market. Grass}is grown to make{silage}to feed the cattle, then they are weighed and when they are the right weight, they are taken to the abbattoir. { Spring}is a busy time for a farmer because of{lambing.}Often farmers have to be up for much of the night tending the ewes as they give birth. When the{rams}are big enough they are sent to market, the{ewes}are kept for{wool}and{lambing. The farmers take their cattle to the markets in{St.Austell and {Liskeard.
